Class PlayerComponent

java.lang.Object
com.almasb.fxgl.entity.component.Component
com.arena.dual_arena.components.PlayerComponent
public class PlayerComponent extends com.almasb.fxgl.entity.component.Component
Component that manages all player-related interactions including movement controls, weapon handling, and collision responses such as knockback.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerComponent

      public PlayerComponent(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode inputUp, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode inputDown, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode inputLeft, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode inputRight, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode primaryFire, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode secondaryFire, javafx.scene.input.KeyCode dropWeapon)
      Constructs a PlayerComponent with specific controls for movement and actions.
      Parameters:
      inputUp - KeyCode for moving up.
      inputDown - KeyCode for moving down.
      inputLeft - KeyCode for moving left.
      inputRight - KeyCode for moving right.
      primaryFire - KeyCode for primary fire action.
      secondaryFire - KeyCode for secondary fire action.
      dropWeapon - KeyCode for dropping the weapon.

  • Method Details

    • onAdded

      public void onAdded()
      Initializes player controls when the component is added to an entity. This method sets up input bindings for player actions such as movement and weapon usage.
      Overrides:
      onAdded in class com.almasb.fxgl.entity.component.Component

    • onUpdate

      public void onUpdate(double tpf)
      Updates the player component each frame, processing movement, input, and knockback effects. This method is called every frame to ensure the player's state is updated based on current inputs and interactions such as collisions causing knockback.
      Overrides:
      onUpdate in class com.almasb.fxgl.entity.component.Component
      Parameters:
      tpf - Time per frame, which is used to scale movement and timing calculations.

    • initController

      public void initController()
      Initializes the game controller environment and assigns a controller to this player based on their unique ID. This method sets up the system properties to locate the controller library and identifies available gamepads. Each player component is then linked to a specific controller if available.

    • pollController

      public void pollController()
      Polls the assigned game controller for input events and processes these events to control the player. This method updates the player's movement based on joystick positions and triggers actions based on button presses.

    • move

      public void move()

    • getXvalue

      public double getXvalue()
      Retrieves the horizontal movement input value. This value is often obtained from a game controller's left joystick x-axis or a keyboard input simulation.
      Returns:
      The current horizontal input value, ranging from -1.0 (left) to 1.0 (right).

    • getYvalue

      public double getYvalue()
      Retrieves the vertical movement input value. This value is typically obtained from a game controller's left joystick y-axis or a keyboard input simulation.
      Returns:
      The current vertical input value, ranging from -1.0 (up) to 1.0 (down).

    • getRightStickX

      public float getRightStickX()
      Retrieves the horizontal value of the right joystick. This input is primarily used for aiming or camera control in many games.
      Returns:
      The horizontal position of the right joystick, ranging from -1.0 (left) to 1.0 (right).

    • getRightStickY

      public float getRightStickY()
      Retrieves the vertical value of the right joystick. This input is commonly used for aiming or camera control, particularly in games requiring vertical aim adjustments.
      Returns:
      The vertical position of the right joystick, ranging from -1.0 (up) to 1.0 (down).

    • initInput

      protected void initInput()
      Initializes and binds input actions for the player based on predefined key codes. This setup includes bindings for movement, primary and secondary weapon firing, and dropping weapons. Each input action is identified by a unique identifier to support multiple players.

    • fireWithRb

      public void fireWithRb()
      Fires the primary weapon associated with the right bumper button on the controller. This method calculates the firing direction based on the current rotation of the equipped weapon and triggers the primary firing mechanism.

    • fireWithLb

      public void fireWithLb()
      Fires the secondary weapon associated with the left bumper button on the controller. This method calculates the firing direction similar to `fireWithRb` but triggers the secondary firing mechanism.

    • applyKnockback

      public void applyKnockback(javafx.geometry.Point2D direction, float knockbackForce)
      Applies a knockback force to the player in a specified direction. This method adjusts the player's velocity based on the direction and magnitude of the knockback force.
      Parameters:
      direction - The unit vector direction in which the knockback is applied.
      knockbackForce - The magnitude of the knockback.

    • resetKnockback

      public void resetKnockback()

    • getMovementModifier

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getMovementModifier()
      Retrieves a movement modifier based on the player's knockback state. This method adjusts the player's speed to simulate resistance during knockback.
      Returns:
      A Point2D representing the movement modifier.

    • pickupWeapon

      public void pickupWeapon(com.almasb.fxgl.entity.Entity weapon)
      Equips a weapon entity to the player if the weapon is not already picked up. This method also handles the transition of the weapon's state from the world to being equipped by the player.
      Parameters:
      weapon - The weapon entity to be picked up.

    • dropWeapon

      public void dropWeapon()
      Drops the currently equipped weapon, if any, and resets its state.

    • getEquippedWeapon

      public com.almasb.fxgl.entity.Entity getEquippedWeapon()
      Retrieves the currently equipped weapon entity.
      Returns:
      The equipped weapon entity, or null if no weapon is equipped.

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Retrieves the unique identifier for this player.
      Returns:
      The unique ID of the player.

    • setYvalue

      public void setYvalue(double i)

    • setXvalue

      public void setXvalue(double i)
